item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, May 18, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: I modeled the Voynich Manuscript with SBERT to test for structure (133 points | 29 comments)
2. Spaced repetition systems have gotten way better (434 points | 307 comments)
3. $30 Homebrew Automated Blinds Opener (31 points | 11 comments)
4. Spaced Repetition Memory System (51 points | 1 comment)

6. Emergent social conventions and collective bias in LLM populations (20 points | 1 comment)
7. Show HN: Buckaroo – Data table UI for Notebooks (31 points | 3 comments)
8. Show HN: Hardtime.nvim – break bad habits and master Vim motions (112 points | 41 comments)
9. O(n) vs. O(n^2) Startups (10 points | 6 comments)
10. Show HN: Racketmeter – Measure Badminton String Tension Using Sound Frequency (9 points | 1 comment)
11. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (115 points | 8 comments)
12. Building my childhood dream PC (35 points | 18 comments)
13. An Uplifting Origin of 86 (2001) (11 points | discuss)
14. How the humble chestnut traced the rise and fall of the Roman Empire (9 points | discuss)
15. Magic Leap One Bootloader Exploit (37 points | 3 comments)

18. Mystical (320 points | 39 comments)
19. Show HN: A web browser agent in your Chrome side panel (84 points | 47 comments)
20. Working with Git Patches in Apple Mail (2023) (28 points | 13 comments)

22. Paper Mechanisms (47 points | 1 comment)
23. The Conquest of Hell Gate [pdf] (42 points | 8 comments)
24. Project Verona: Fearless Concurrency for Python (139 points | 107 comments)
25. Show HN: Chat with 19 years of HN (71 points | 44 comments)
26. Lessons from Mixing Rust and Java: Fast, Safe, and Practical (104 points | 32 comments)
27. High Available Mosquitto MQTT on Kubernetes (37 points | 15 comments)
28. What Every Programmer Should Know About Enumerative Combinatorics (64 points | 33 comments)
29. Google fixes high severity Chrome flaw with public exploit (4 points | discuss)
30. Pluto Flyover from New Horizons (40 points | 11 comments)
